title: WCAS GERMAN 327-0-20 German Expressionism
class_attributes:
Literature & Fine Arts Distro Area

Reading, writing, speaking proficiency

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will provide an overview of German Expressionism in literature, visual art, and film from the late nineteenth century to the beginnings of World War II, looking at the stylistic and thematic innovations of this period and their continuing influence today. The social context of the period will be discussed, as well as various themes closely related to the development of Expressionism in German culture, including but not limited to: crime and violence, sexuality, madness, the occult, war and trauma, the city, capitalism, the role of ethnic and cultural minorities, the appeal of the exotic, the rise of new technologies, and visions of decadence and catastrophe. Students will also continue to develop their reading, writing, speaking, and listening skills in German on an advanced level.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite in German: High Intermediate skills in speaking, advanced skills in reading and writing.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
- Become familiar with some of the major works of Expressionism in literature, art, and film
- Understand cultural and political developments in Germany and German-speaking countries in the first few decades of the twentieth century
- Develop critical and analytic skills in literature, visual arts, film, and other media
- Increase facility in spoken, written, and read German
